#Setup Neuron model
from neuprint import Client

TOKEN = "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJlbWFpbCI6Im5nMjgwMWFAc3R1ZGVudC5hbWVyaWNhbi5lZHUiLCJsZXZlbCI6Im5vYXV0aCIsImltYWdlLXVybCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vbGgzLmdvb2dsZXVzZXJjb250ZW50LmNvbS9hL0FBVFhBSndNLXljTFZ2bUQzM3NhYkdkZ09iR2xVenUxWWF1N1dsVDBBN3NxPXM5Ni1jP3N6PTUwP3N6PTUwIiwiZXhwIjoxODAzMDc5MTM4fQ.SWiapznzJ2zKyKuccDWw4sjXsjqm4YnALk4DR3DGGmY" # <--- Paste your token here
         

client = Client("neuprint.janelia.org", "hemibrain:v1.0.1", TOKEN)

source: conda install -c conda-forge ngspice umap-learn scikit-learn matplotlib

# simulate a PEG neuron (same type as in hemibrain paper)
from neuprint import NeuronModel
nm = NeuronModel(449438847)

res = nm.simulate(2)
